West led the , ducked around. I won the continuation, and exited a club. East won and played a heart, which I ruffed, West following. I ruffed a club high, back with a trump, West pitching a club. I ruffed another club, and again back with a trump. I took the spade finesse, and came back with a third round of trumps, ending up in this position:
West pitched his clubs on the diamonds, but on the last diamond, West was squeezed in the majors.
opposite always screams out to me. In another hand in this collection, I give an example where West is stripped and endplayed into giving up a third trick to this holding.

Perhaps this holding makes it easier for me to see the squeeze or endplay possibilities. I am already aware that I want the king of the suit to be onside. I visualize West with the king, and a key step in a squeeze or endplay is visualization.
The above squeeze works just as well if I have in hand and in dummy, but I might be less inclined to find it because I'm not asking myself, "what if West has the queen of spades?"
